com.riskgame.service

Class CreateAndEditMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.riskgame.service.CreateAndEditMap

  • public class CreateAndEditMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class aims to create the new map by taking user inputs and also checks the validation of various fields before saving the map. The values are saved in the form of an object and then passed to the called function to perform user asked operation.
    Author:
    Shresthi Garg

      • newMapCreation

        public boolean newMapCreation()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the user prompts to create a map. It takes values from user for Map tag data, continents, country, adjacency and lets user delete/add the same. Also, lets user view the contents added.
        Returns:
        returnflag of type boolean whose value decides whether the user is good to start the start game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • uploadMap

        public boolean uploadMap(GameMapGraph uploadedmapGraph)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the user prompts to load a map. It lets user to edit the map and save the map and continue further with the game if the ap is valid.
        Parameters:
        uploadedmapGraph - - It is an object of GameMapGraph class and contains the data retrieved from the loaded file.
        Returns:
        returnflag of type boolean which decides whether user can start the same.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createMapTag

        public void createMapTag()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method aims to create map tag data. It prompts the user to enter the fields related to map tag and also performs various validation with respect to the map tag. Post validating it stores the details of the map tag in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setContinentDetails

        public void setContinentDetails()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method aims to create continent details. It prompts the user to enter the fields related to continent and also performs various validation with respect to the continent. Post validating it stores the details of the continent in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setCountryDetails

        public void setCountryDetails()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method aims to create country details. It prompts the user to enter the fields related to country and also performs various validation with respect to the country. Post validating it stores the details of the country in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • alreadyDefinedContinent

        public boolean alreadyDefinedContinent(java.lang.String continentName)
        This method aims to check whether the continent is already defined by the user.
        Parameters:
        continentName - - The continent name entered by the user.
        Returns:
        flag of type boolean which tells the continent is already defined or not.

      • checkandupdateAdjacentCountries

        public void checkandupdateAdjacentCountries(java.lang.String forcountry,
                                            java.lang.String adcountry)
        This method checks and updates the adjacency between two countries.
        Parameters:
        forcountry - - The country which has defined an adjacent country.
        adcountry - - The country which has been defined adjacent.

      • deleteContinent

        public void deleteContinent()
        This method aims to delete a continent. It prompts the user to enter the continent to be deleted and also performs various validation with respect to the country. Post validating it stores the details of the country in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.

      • deleteCountry

        public void deleteCountry()
        This method aims to delete a country. It prompts the user to enter the country to be deleted and also performs various validation with respect to the country. Post validating it stores the details of the country in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.

      • addAdjacency

        public void addAdjacency()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method aims to add adjacency between two countries. It prompts the user to enter the the countries they wish to be adjacent and also performs various validation with respect to the country. Post validating it stores the details of the country in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeAdjacency

        public void removeAdjacency()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method aims to remove adjacency between two countries. It prompts the user to enter the the countries they wish to not be adjacent and also performs various validation with respect to the country. Post validating it stores the details of the country in the GameMapGraph object It returns to the parent function for creating a map.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checkandSave

        public boolean checkandSave()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method aims to perform various validation with respect to the saving a map info entered by user during create to the map. Post validating it throws the error for the user to resolve and returns the control back to the calling method.
        Returns:
        flag- Boolean type, which determines whether we can allow the player to go ahead and play the game.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        This method aims to print the content of the map over the console.
